FuncDef: This command opens a Telnet session to a remote host. Telnet servers in SR-series networks limit Telnet clients to three attempts to login; this number is not user configurable. The Telnet server disconnects the Telnet client session after three attempts.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the IP address or the DNS name (providing DNS name resolution is configured). Values-ipv4-address|a.b.c.d|, ipv6-address |x:x:x:x:x:x:x:x[-interface]x:x:x:x:x:x:d.d.d.d[-interface]|x:   [0 to FFFF]Hd:   [0 to 255]D ipv6-addressinterface: 32 chars max, mandatory for link local addresses, dns-name|128 chars max|.
Specifies the DNS name (if DNS name resolution is configured) up to 128 characters in length.
Specifies the TCP port number to use Telnet to the remote host, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 65535. ParamDefault: Default- 23

Specifies the router name or service ID used to identify the router instance. Values-router-instance : router-name or vprn-svc-id, |router-name|"Base", "management", vpls-management", |vprn-svc-id|1 to 2147483647. ParamDefault: Default- Base
Specifies the service name up to 64 characters in length.
